relations.Subject: UNDP
relations.Description:
UNDP will also promote 
transformation (including digital) of the Parliament and other institutions to enhance checks 
and balances and ensure a ‘whole-of-government’ approach, strengthened separation of 
powers and cross-party work.

relations.Subject: Parliament
relations.Description:
The Parliament will play a key 
role, serving as an important platform for evidence-based policymaking and citizen 
engagement.

relations.Subject: UNDP
relations.Description:
UNDP will encourage development dialogue with Parliament, the private sector and civil 
society organizations (CSOs).

relations.Subject: partners
relations.Description:
Key partners include MAT, MASFAMU, Parliament, local governments, CSOs 
and bilateral donor partners.

relations.Subject: which
relations.Description:
In 2016 amendments to Law on Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy were approved by Parliament 
which included some specific minimum energy efficiency requirements.

relations.Subject: UNDP
relations.Description:
UNDP will engage key oversight institutions 
such as the Parliament and commissions to facilitate people’s participation in governance 
processes and strengthen recourse to remedy grievances.
